channel.title: SOPA & Protect IP Act
channel.description:
[i]Why hasn't there been any announcements about these bills on these forums?[/i] This bill threatens forums like these, and other messaging systems. This threatens American's freedom of speech, and I believe that the majority of users here are American.
Also, to protest SOPA (and protect ip act), if you have GoDaddy [b]transfer your domains from GoDaddy[/b] as they're one of largest domain registers and [b]they're supporting SOPA.[/b]
You can learn more on http://americancensorship.org/
Serious issue, in fact, PIPA has already been passed by Senate Judiciary Committee..
Also, yes, I know this is fucking old news, but there really needs to be awareness about this on forums like these (if this bill is passed, kiss these forums/similar forums goodbye). So spread the word.

item.title: SOPA & Protect IP Act
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:20, topic:426481”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=529176.msg3865188#msg3865188 date=1324946757]

Congress has a 9% approval rating. I think we are okay, and should stop w/ these threads.

[/quote]
That doesn’t necessarily have anything to do with the outcome of the bill.[/quote]
It more then likely won’t get passed at 9%, even if it is modified countless times and a shitton of pork is put on.

Read full topic

item.title: SOPA & Protect IP Act
item.dc:creator: @artego artego
item.description:
@artego wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:14, topic:426481”][quote author=artego link=topic=529176.msg3864474#msg3864474 date=1324899414]

There’s not a topic because nothing is really going ot happen to us. We already release illegal clients and we haven’t been shut down. The bill gives the ability to block sites threatening the united states, not teenagers messing around with a UK game.

Actually it does that, the point is they can do all of that without you even getting a process. This new law can give people 5 years of jail because they cover a song and post it on youtube + only that one song could take youtube down. It’s like a driver of a toyata car that causes toyota to be shut down. Although they have nothing to do with the way the car drives. This is a very dangerous law that could give power to the wrong people! This will also stop innovation in a lot of countries and not only the USA, the power of the game industry and media industry will be in the hands of big companies! Because if your like me and you are developing a little game that might have succes, and a big company doesn’t like it then they will tell the governement to shut that site down. They could even held me responsible for something illegal they post on my forums in theory! Now I don’t say this is all going to happen when this law passes, but it is very dangerous that bit can happen if the wrong people get the control over it. Oh and by the way about moparscape, atm they can’t block it because jagex doesn’t have the right to enter this. When this law passes they just have to walk to the american governemet and say that the site just contains !!1 link!! to something malicious and they will have the ability to shut it down!
[/quote]
Stop believing what you read on the internet and read the actual bill in full yourself. I had to read the thing for one of my classes and do a report on it, we are fine, will be fine, and will in the future, always be fine. Youtube and Facebook will continue to exist (even though I think the world would be better off without social networking sites).[/quote]
Even if this law wouldn’t be used in any way then still I think it shouldn’t exist because it can always be used by future governements. You say we will be “fine”, and we probably will but I just don’t see any reason for making this law.

Read full topic

item.title: SOPA & Protect IP Act
item.dc:creator: @Pzezima2 Pzezima2
item.description:
@Pzezima2 wrote:

VentureBeat – 25 Dec 11

Go Daddy loses over 37,000 domains due to SOPA stance

Hosting and domain registrar company Go Daddy has lost more than 37,000 domains in the past two days due to the company’s wishy-washy stance on the Stop Online Piracy Act. The fleeing domains…

Read full topic

item.title: SOPA & Protect IP Act
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“artego, post:13, topic:426481”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=529176.msg3861038#msg3861038 date=1324675798]
There’s not a topic because nothing is really going ot happen to us. We already release illegal clients and we haven’t been shut down. The bill gives the ability to block sites threatening the united states, not teenagers messing around with a UK game.
[/quote]
Actually it does that, the point is they can do all of that without you even getting a process. This new law can give people 5 years of jail because they cover a song and post it on youtube + only that one song could take youtube down. It’s like a driver of a toyata car that causes toyota to be shut down. Although they have nothing to do with the way the car drives. This is a very dangerous law that could give power to the wrong people! This will also stop innovation in a lot of countries and not only the USA, the power of the game industry and media industry will be in the hands of big companies! Because if your like me and you are developing a little game that might have succes, and a big company doesn’t like it then they will tell the governement to shut that site down. They could even held me responsible for something illegal they post on my forums in theory! Now I don’t say this is all going to happen when this law passes, but it is very dangerous that bit can happen if the wrong people get the control over it. Oh and by the way about moparscape, atm they can’t block it because jagex doesn’t have the right to enter this. When this law passes they just have to walk to the american governemet and say that the site just contains !!1 link!! to something malicious and they will have the ability to shut it down![/quote]
Stop believing what you read on the internet and read the actual bill in full yourself. I had to read the thing for one of my classes and do a report on it, we are fine, will be fine, and will in the future, always be fine. Youtube and Facebook will continue to exist (even though I think the world would be better off without social networking sites).

Read full topic

Andrew Ferguson:

There’s not a topic because nothing is really going ot happen to us. We already release illegal clients and we haven’t been shut down. The bill gives the ability to block sites threatening the united states, not teenagers messing around with a UK game.

Actually it does that, the point is they can do all of that without you even getting a process. This new law can give people 5 years of jail because they cover a song and post it on youtube + only that one song could take youtube down. It’s like a driver of a toyata car that causes toyota to be shut down. Although they have nothing to do with the way the car drives. This is a very dangerous law that could give power to the wrong people! This will also stop innovation in a lot of countries and not only the USA, the power of the game industry and media industry will be in the hands of big companies! Because if your like me and you are developing a little game that might have succes, and a big company doesn’t like it then they will tell the governement to shut that site down. Now I don’t say this is all going to happen when this law passes, but it is very dangerous that bit can happen if the wrong people get the control over it. Oh and by the way about moparscape, atm they can’t block it because jagex doesn’t have the right to enter this. When this law passes they just have to walk to the american governemet and say that the site just contains !!1 link!! to something malicious and they will have the ability to shut it down!

item.title: SOPA & Protect IP Act
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

It is the internet… can’t do shit.

They or us? There’s two things that politicians care about: Money and votes. Obviously, if we unite we can get both, and win. Currently, there is basically a media black out about this because they don’t want the public to know. Google, Wikipedia, Facebook, the list goes on, have all sent a letter to congress opposing this bill. You should do the same. Mail your rep. or senator. If they find it a threat for them to vote yes for this bill, then they will vote no.

Read full topic

They’re trying to pass this quietly. If all online users knew about this and there were an official poll, it would be like the bring back free trade & wilderness poll runescape hosted. 1.2 million votes in 24 hours with a 95% vote of yes.

item.title: SOPA & Protect IP Act
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

runewings317:

I’m guessing this means we won’t be aloud to have our private servers anymore am I correct?

This. I’m assuming that you’re hosting offshore, and if-so, they’ll simply block your domain on all American DNS servers. Alternatively, you could just use direct IP, but I believe they’re also having direct IP blocking as well.

Read full topic
